channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [WFLY-2096] WeldApplicationFactory doesn't implement setApplication() correctly
item.description:
The problem is described in WELD-913. The fix was only applied to Weld servlet support [1] and not AS7/WildFly8 integration code (most probably because the target environment of the issue was Tomcat).

[1]
https://github.com/weld/core/blob/master/environments/servlet/core/src/main/java/org/jboss/weld/environment/servlet/jsf/WeldApplicationFactory.java

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Tomas Repel <trepel@redhat.com> made a comment on bug 1008998

Description of problem:

The problem is described in https://issues.jboss.org/browse/WELD-913. The fix was only applied to Weld servlet support [1] and not AS7/WildFly8/EAP6 integration code (most probably because the target environment of the issue was Tomcat).

There is also related discussion at https://community.jboss.org/thread/232605. This issue prevents Spring WebFlow/JSF applications with file WEB-INF/beans.xml to work correctly on EAP 6.1.0.GA.

The possible fix of the issue is to add setApplication() method to org.jboss.as.weld.webtier.jsf.WeldApplicationFactory class:

@Override
public void setApplication(Application application) {
synchronized (this)

{ this.application = null; super.setApplication(application); }

}

[1]
https://github.com/weld/core/blob/master/environments/servlet/core/src/main/java/org/jboss/weld/environment/servlet/jsf/WeldApplicationFactory.java

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):

EAP 6.1.0.GA

How reproducible:

Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. deploy attached war on EAP 6.1.0.GA
2. try to log in and book a hotel

Actual results:

13:08:58,805 ERROR [org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.[jboss.web].[default-host].[/spring-booking-faces].[Spring MVC Dispatcher Servlet]] (http-localhost/127.0.0.1:8080-5) JBWEB000236: Servlet.service() for servlet Spring MVC Dispatcher Servlet threw exception: java.io.FileNotFoundException

Expected results:

The booking completes without errors.

Tomas Repel <trepel@redhat.com> made a comment on bug 1008998

Sorry, I can't attach the war due to its too big size (20M). To download the war please use this link: http://download.eng.brq.redhat.com/scratch/trepel/spring-booking-faces.war.
